org.ligoj.app.resource.node

Class NodeResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ligoj.app.resource.node.AbstractLockedResource<java.lang.String>
      • org.ligoj.app.resource.node.NodeResource

  • @Path(value="/node")
 @Service
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public class NodeResource
extends AbstractLockedResource<java.lang.String>
    Node resource.

public void update(NodeEditionVo vo)

      • delete

        @DELETE
 @Path(value="{id:service:.+:.+:.*}")
public void delete(@PathParam(value="id")
                                                                 java.lang.String id)
                                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Delete an existing Node from its identifier. The whole cache of nodes is invalidated. The deletion can only succeed if there are no related subscription. They need to be previously deleted. The administrator rights are also checked.
        Parameters:
        id - The node identifier.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • checkNodesStatus

        @POST
 @Path(value="status/refresh")
public void checkNodesStatus()
        Check status of each node instance. Only visible nodes from the current user are checked.

      • checkNodeStatus

        @POST
 @Path(value="status/refresh/{id:.+:.*}")
 @OnNullReturn404
public org.ligoj.app.api.NodeStatus checkNodeStatus(@PathParam(value="id")
                                                                                                                      java.lang.String id)
        Check status of a specific node instance. Only visible node from the current user is checked.
        Parameters:
        id - The node identifier to check.
        Returns:
        the new status or null if undefined of not visible.

      • checkNodeStatus

        public org.ligoj.app.api.NodeStatus checkNodeStatus(java.lang.String node,
                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Check the status of a node. This method need to be public for the CGLIB proxying.
        Parameters:
        node - The node identifier.
        parameters - Node parameters used to check the status.
        Returns:
        The node status.

public void checkSubscriptionsStatusScheduler()

      • checkSubscriptionsStatus

        @POST
 @Path(value="status/subscription/refresh")
public void checkSubscriptionsStatus()

 @Path(value="status")

      • getNodeStatus

        @GET
 @Path(value="status/{id:.+:.*}")
 @OnNullReturn404
public org.ligoj.app.api.NodeStatus getNodeStatus(@PathParam(value="id")
                                                                                                           java.lang.String id)
        Retrieve a specific node status.
        Parameters:
        id - The node to check.
        Returns:
        Status of a single node. Many be null when node is not found or when there is not known status.

      • getNodeStatistics

        @GET
 @Path(value="status/subscription")
public java.util.List<NodeStatisticsVo> getNodeStatistics()
        Retrieve node statistics.
        Returns:
        Last known status of all nodes.

      • findById

        @GET
 @Path(value="{id:.+:.*}")
 @Transactional(readOnly=true)
public NodeVo findById(@PathParam(value="id")
                                                                                      java.lang.String id)
        Return a specific node visible for current user. The visibility is checked.
        Parameters:
        id - The node identifier.
        Returns:
        The visible node. Never null.

      • findByIdInternal

        @Transactional(readOnly=true)
public NodeVo findByIdInternal(java.lang.String id)
        Return a specific node details. The visibility is not checked, and the cache is not involved.
        Parameters:
        id - The node identifier.
        Returns:
        The node. Cannot be null.

      • findAll

        @GET
 @Transactional(readOnly=true)
public org.ligoj.bootstrap.core.json.TableItem<NodeVo> findAll(@Context
                                                                                                   javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                                                                                   @QueryParam(value="search[value]")
                                                                                                   java.lang.String criteria,
                                                                                                   @QueryParam(value="refined")
                                                                                                   java.lang.String refined,
                                                                                                   @QueryParam(value="mode")
                                                                                                   org.ligoj.app.api.SubscriptionMode mode,
                                                                                                   @QueryParam(value="depth") @DefaultValue(value="-1")
                                                                                                   int depth)
        Return all visible nodes for current user. The hierarchy data is returned but without UI data.
        Parameters:
        uriInfo - pagination data.
        criteria - the optional criteria to match.
        parent - The optional parent identifier to be like. Special attention for 'service' value corresponding to the root.
        mode - Expected subscription mode. When null, the node's mode is not checked.
        depth - The maximal depth. When 0 means no refined, so basically services only. 1 means refined is a service, so nodes are basically tool only. 2 means refined is a tool, so nodes are basically instances only. For the other cases, there is no limit, and corresponds to the default behavior.
        Returns:
        All visible nodes with the hierarchy but without UI data.

      • findAll

        @Transactional(readOnly=true)
public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,NodeVo> findAll()
        Return all nodes with the hierarchy. Key is the identifier of the nodes.
        Returns:
        all nodes without UI data.
